definitions.text: a separately printed article that originally appeared in a larger publication
a garment that can be purchased separately and worn in combinations with other garments
act as a barrier between; stand between
examples: The mountain range divides the two countries
He separated the fighting children
Moses parted the Red Sea
We distinguish several kinds of maple
divide the cake into three equal parts
The British carved up the Ottoman Empire after World War I
Separate the wheat from the chaff

definitions.text: arrange or order by classes or categories
examples: How would you classify these pottery shards--are they prehistoric?

definitions.text: discontinue an association or relation; go different ways
examples: The business partners broke over a tax question
The couple separated after 25 years of marriage
My friend and I split up

definitions.text: go one's own way; move apart
examples: The friends separated after the party

definitions.text: become separated into pieces or fragments
examples: The figurine broke
The freshly baked loaf fell apart

definitions.text: treat differently on the basis of sex or race

examples: The two pieces that we had glued separated

definitions.text: divide into two or more branches so as to form a fork
examples: The road forks
a problem consisting of two separate issues
they went their separate ways
formed a separate church

definitions.text: standing apart; not attached to or supported by anything
examples: a freestanding bell tower
a house with a separate garage

definitions.text: separated according to race, sex, class, or religion
examples: separate but equal
girls and boys in separate classes

definitions.text: have the connection undone; having become separate
